at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.gamepad

Class GamepadConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection.Connection
      • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.gamepad.GamepadConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GamepadConnection
extends Connection
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Being a concrete implementation of the Connection class, this class basic function is to communicate with a remote device connected to the RMCS - a gamepad in this case.
    This implementation reads data from a gamepad, creates IControlData-sets accordingly (if in control) and puts them on the Connection.controlDataQueue.
    It is also able to send control-change-requests to the main-thread.
    If there is more than one gamepad connected to the RMCS, one gamepad cannot be in control of the DriveControlData and the CameraControlData at the same time. One will be in control of the drive and one will be in control of the camera.
    These controls can be passed onto the next gamepad, however. This is done by pressing the start-button or select-button for at least 500ms to pass on the control of the drive or the camera, respectively.
    If the next gamepad happens to be in control of one of the control-sets already, that gamepad is skipped and the control is automatically passed on to the next gamepad in the list.
    If the mode-button is pressed at least 500ms, complete control is passed to the ServerConnection.
    Control between phone and gamepad can also be toggled by pressing both thumb-buttons and both upper-triggers for at least 1000ms.
    Author:
    Boeck

      • GamepadConnection

        public GamepadConnection(long carId,
                         java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue,
                         java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue,
                         net.java.games.input.Controller gamepad)
        Parameters:
        carId - the ID that the RMCS registers itself with on the Server.
        controlDataQueue - the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.
        controlChangeQueue - the queue that is used to signal the main class to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.
        gamepad - the actual Controller-Object of the jinput-package that is used to communicate with the gamepad.

        gamepad - the actual Controller-Object of the jinput-package that is used to communicate with the gamepad.
        solo - true, if this is the only connected gamepad, otherwise false.

    • Method Detail

      • updateControllingDevice

        public boolean updateControllingDevice(long connectionIdInControl,
                                       EDataType dataType)
        Used to update Connection.connectionIdInDriveControl, Connection.connectionIdInDriveControl and Connection.connectionIdInDriveControl, depending on the dataType that was passed.
        The control-update method for the GamepadConnection has the additional task of making sure that one GamepadConnection cannot be in control of the the drive and the camera at the same time.
        This would normally not be necessary, but instead has been implemented to demonstrate the flexibility of the core code, even for the gamepad-related components.
        Actually, this override causes some kind of deadlock in the current implementation, because the controlChangeQueue is permanently written to, if only one gamepad is connected.
        Overrides:
        updateControllingDevice in class Connection
        Parameters:
        connectionIdInControl - the new ID that is currently in control of the specified control-data.
        dataType - the control-data-type the specified ID is currently in control of.
        Returns:
        true, if the passed dataType is valid and the corresponding control-ID updated, otherwise false.

        Parameters:
        gamepad - the gamepad, that the ControllerMapping should be determined for.

      • detectAndProcessControlChanges

        private void detectAndProcessControlChanges(java.lang.Long startedPressingThrottleModeChange,
                                            java.lang.Long startedPressingSteeringModeChange,
                                            java.lang.Long startedPressingControlChange,
                                            java.lang.Long startedPressingGamepadDriveControlChange,
                                            java.lang.Long startedPressingGamepadCameraControlChange)
        Parameters:
        startedPressingThrottleModeChange - timestamp, since the button to change the throttle mode has started to get pressed down. -1 if it is not pressed down at the moment.
        startedPressingSteeringModeChange - timestamp, since the button to change the steering mode has started to get pressed down. -1 if it is not pressed down at the moment.
        startedPressingControlChange - timestamp, since the button to pass the control onto the ServerConnection has started to get pressed down. -1 if it is not pressed down at the moment.
        startedPressingGamepadDriveControlChange - timestamp, since the button to pass on the drive-control has started to get pressed down. -1 if it is not pressed down at the moment.
        startedPressingGamepadCameraControlChange - timestamp, since the button to pass on the camera-control has started to get pressed down. -1 if it is not pressed down at the moment.
